text: This is a list of wars involving the Republic of Azerbaijan and its predecessor states, the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic and the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic. == List == Conflict Combatant 1 Combatant 2 Results Azerbaijan Democratic Republic (1918–1920) Caucasus Campaign of World War I (1914–1918) Azerbaijan Mountain Republic \---- Georgia * Administration of Western Armenia Armenia Central Caspian Dictatorship \---- * Baku Commune Inconclusive * Azerbaijan declares independence Russian Civil War (1918–1920) White movement \---- Azerbaijan Finland Georgia Ukrainian State Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic Commune of Estonia Lithuanian SSR Latvian SSR Withdrawal Mughan clashes (1918–1919) Azerbaijan White Movement Mughan Soviet Republic Victory * Azerbaijan regains control of Mugan plain Armenian–Azerbaijani War (1918–1920) Azerbaijan Republic of Aras \---- * Soviet Azerbaijan Armenia Centrocaspian Dictatorship Inconclusive Red Army invasion of Azerbaijan (1920) Azerbaijan * Azerbaijani Bolsheviks Defeat * Azerbaijan is invaded and becomes part of the Soviet Union as the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic (Soviet Azerbaijan) Soviet Socialist Republic of Azerbaijan (1920–1991) Anti- Soviet rebellions: * Ganja Uprising (1920) * Tartar Uprising (1920) * Lankaran Uprisings (1920–22) * Soviet Azerbaijan Rebels Defeat * Defeat of the Azerbaijani anti-Soviet rebels Red Army invasion of Georgia (1921) * Soviet Azerbaijan Georgia Victory * Georgia is invaded and becomes part of the Soviet Union as the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic (Soviet Georgia) World War II (1939–1945) * Soviet Azerbaijan Germany * Azerbaijani Legion Victory * 800,000 Azerbaijanis fought in Soviet Army, 400,000 of whom were killed. * 70,000 Azerbaijanis, mainly former POW volunteers, fought in the Wehrmacht. Soviet–Afghan War (1979–1989) * Soviet Azerbaijan Peshawar Seven Withdrawal * 10,000 Azerbaijanis fought in Soviet Army, 200 of whom were killed. Republic of Azerbaijan (1991–) First Nagorno-Karabakh War (1988–1994) Azerbaijan Defeat * Bishkek Protocol, Nagorno-Karabakh is de facto independent from Azerbaijan. Ganja Uprising (1993) Huseynov's forces Azerbaijani government Coup d'état failed * Change of Azerbaijani government OPON coup d'état attempt (1995) OPON Azerbaijani government Victory * Coup d'état failed, Azerbaijani government stays in power Gobustan Uprising (1999) Musayev's forces Azerbaijani government Victory * Rebellion suppressed Operation Eagle (2008) Caucasus Emirate * Forest Brothers Victory * Jihadists defeated Four- Day War (2016) Inconclusive * Small Azerbaijani land gains Operation Gyunnut (2018) Inconclusive Second Nagorno-Karabakh war (2020) Victory * 2020 ceasefire agreement Armenia–Azerbaijan border crisis (2021–2023) Ongoing * Azerbaijan occupies parts of Armenian territory == Peacekeeping missions == Mission Start-date End-date Location Troops (peak) KFOR 1999 2008 34 MNF-I 2003 2008 250 ISAF 2008 2021 94 == References == Category:Azerbaijan-related lists
title: List of wars involving Azerbaijan
